intro: Zehneria scabra var. chirindensis, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its rough, hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in spikes, which are typically clustered at the leaf axils. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets. Its botanical features make it identifiable within the Rubiaceae family, which includes other economically important plants.
